nars.term

Interface Term

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable, Termed, Termlike
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    BooleanCondition<C>, Compound<T>, ProcTerm<C>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractLiteral, AbstractStringAtom, AbstractStringAtomRaw, AndCondition, Atom, Atomic, AtomicBooleanCondition, AtomObject, CommonVariable, Derive, dt, Ellipsis, EllipsisMatch, EllipsisOneOrMore, EllipsisTransform, EllipsisZeroOrMore, Event, Event.After, GenericCompound, ImageIndexEquals, InputPremises, MatchOp, MatchTaskBelief, MatchTerm, NotEqual, occurr, Operator, ParentTerm, PatternCompound, PatternOp, PreCondition1, PreCondition1Output, PreCondition2, PreCondition3, PremiseBranch, PremiseMatchFork, PremiseRule, Return, Solve, Space, StringAtom, Subterm, SubTermOp, SubTermStructure, SymbolExpression, TaskBeliefPair, TaskNegative, TaskPunctuation, Temporality, TermEquals, TermOpEquals, TermSizeEquals, TermStructure, TermVolumeMin, ThenFork, Variable, Variable.VarDep, Variable.VarIndep, Variable.VarQuery, VarPattern

    public interface Term
extends Termed, java.lang.Comparable, Termlike

      • isCommutative

        boolean isCommutative()
        Commutivity in NARS means that a Compound term's subterms will be unique and arranged in order (compareTo)

        commutative CompoundTerms: Sets, Intersections Commutative Statements: Similarity, Equivalence (except the one with a temporal order) Commutative CompoundStatements: Disjunction, Conjunction (except the one with a temporal order)

        Returns:
        The default value is false
